title: Minecraft: How to Craft and Use a Smoker for Food Smelting

steps.title: Open the crafting table.
steps.content: Open the crafting table . This will open a 3x3 crafting grid. You'll need a Furnace and 4 of any Log, Stem, Stripped Log/Stem, Wood, Hyphae, or Stripped Wood/Hyphae. [1] X Research source This example will use Oak Wood.

steps.title: Place the materials in the grid.
steps.content: Place the materials in the grid. Be sure to place them as follows: Row 1: One Oak Wood in the middle box Row 2: One Oak Wood in the left box, one Furnace in the middle box, one Oak Wood in the right box Row 3: One Oak Wood in the middle box

steps.title: Place the Smoker in your inventory.
steps.content: Place the Smoker in your inventory. You'll see it on the right side of the crafting grid.

steps.title: Food smelting.
steps.content: Food smelting. Unlike the Furnace, Smokers can only be used to smelt Food. This allows you to smelt twice as fast. To smelt food, place a food item and a fuel item into the Smoker.

steps.title: Changing professions.
steps.content: Changing professions. If there's an unclaimed Smoker in a village , it can be used to change a villager's profession to butcher.

steps.title: Light source.
steps.content: Light source. Like other Furnaces, Smokers emit light, which can help keep mobs at bay.

steps.title: Lock.
steps.content: Lock. If you're using Java Edition, you can lock the Smoker using the /data command.

steps.title: Note blocks.
steps.content: Note blocks. If you place a Smoker underneath a note block, it makes a bass drum sound.
